page.title: 15MILK QUOTAS,CALLESTICK,TRURO
page.content: Callestick Farm is a 280 acre dairy & beef farm worked by the farmer,his son & 2 fulltime workers(resident herdsman & general worker from Perranporth). Dairyfarming has been greatly affected by introduction of the E.E.C.milkquota system in 1984. Quotas were calculated on the basis of previous year's milk production minus 10% of that litreage, the aim being to keep within a certain quota for the whole country. Whereas there was encouragement to increase dairy herds in the late 1970's, there is now a penalty for overproduction, & no subsidies for dairyfarmers. Callestick Farm used appeal-tribunal procedure & was granted a slight increase in quota. Many farmers sold cows in order to cut production. While trend is always to improve production dairyfarmers resent being unable to do so,as costs continue to rise.
